Charlie Kirk assassination: The suspect's disconcerting profile
description: Tyler Robinson, arrested on Thursday night, is a 22-year-old White man who grew up in a conservative family in Utah and was a brilliant high school student. Nothing in his background supports the theory being propagated in MAGA circles that he is a far-left activist.

description: 'The government's defeat in a confidence vote illustrates the increased fragmentation and polarization of domestic politics,' Fitch stated as France was downgraded from an 'AA-' to 'A+' rating on Friday.

headline: RFK Jr's health plan leaves America's favorite junk foods off the hook
description: The plan, which is eagerly awaited by the scientific community, aims to address the decline in the health of American children. But it does not include any measures to reduce the presence of unhealthy foods or to limit the population's exposure to chemicals.

headline: 'They want us to be big but without any fat': Plus-size models face return of thinness in the fashion industry
description: They are plus-size models who broke into the fashion industry when inclusivity was on the rise. Today, they are considering working abroad – or even changing careers altogether.

headline: Tasting clubs are discreetly shaping France's wine culture
description: Thousands of enthusiasts gather in associations or informal groups, whether at home or in bars, for themed tastings – some highly structured. The values of sharing and passing on knowledge drive these get-togethers.

In devastated Kathmandu, young Nepalese fear old leaders' return
description: No seat of power was spared in Nepal's capital during two days of unprecedented protest. The army, which has seized control of the country, is negotiating a way out of the crisis after the prime minister resigned and the president disappeared. Yet the young people behind the movement have little say in what comes next.

headline: Blessed with fortune: India's Hare Krishna mega-temple backed by a Ford heir
description: In Mayapur, the monument built in honor of Krishna by his followers could, by 2027, become the largest religious building in the world. This colossal project, begun in 2010, has been largely funded by Alfred Ford, the great-grandson of the car manufacturer.

headline: From a Thai holiday to a Turkish prison: How two women were trapped by drug traffickers
description: The two 20-year-old women from the Paris region enjoyed an all-expenses-paid holiday in Thailand, then given suitcases packed with cannabis before their flight home. Their lawyers argued it was a case of 'great naivety.'
